intro: Psilogramme villosula, commonly known as the hairy psilogramme, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
